text: Bottle shared at Cotteridge convention 05/03/2016. Many thanks t Shane. A hazed golden orange coloured pour with a frothy white head. Aroma is lemon rind, perfumed citrus, little pollen. Flavour is funky, straw grains, semi sweet, apple, little spicy phenon, plastic and belgian yeast. Palate is frothy in the mouth, semi sweet and tangy. Solid beer.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2017 Świetnie pokazane Brety. Właściwie to piwo jest takim klasycznym przykładem użycia tych drożdży. Stajenne aromaty, trochę dojrzałych owoców (Belgia, ale nie na słodko), fajna chmielowa kontra. W wytrawną stronę.  Bardzo dobre.

Bottle with BeerandBlues2! Pours hazy golden amber with a bubbly off white head. Tastes like Brett, herbs, biscuit malt, light citrus, and earth. Light body and low/medium carbonation. Smells like Brett, biscuit malt, light citrus, and straw.

Bottle at home. Pours cloudy orange with a medium, frothy off-white head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma moderate earthy and farmhouse Brettanomyces with grainy and husky malt with light citrus hops. Flavor is moderate farmhouse and funky Brettanomyces with grainy and husky malt, light citrus hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation.

Bottle shared by beerandblues2. Pours hazy amber. Aroma is huge brett and rustic malt character, citrus, floral notes, and light spice. Flavor is crisp and malty with smooth Brett character thats more subdued than the aroma with crisp citrus and a nice, dry finish. Medium body.
Medicinal brett, white wine oak, rotten fruit, apple peel, Belgian yeast, light noble hop bitterness, carbonation a bit too high.

Draught 
Aroma-floral, fruits, barnyard 
Appearance-golden, clear, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-light body, thin feel, lively, short finish
Overall-very refreshing

From tap at Omerta, Kraków. Belgian bretty farmhouse funk aroma with fruits, notes of apple, soft malt, floral-ish notes. Flavour is moderate sweet and a bit tart with a fairly dry finish. Body is medium. Good funky fruity Bretty ale.

tap/omerta. pomarańczowe, klarowne, z białą, grupęcherzykową pianą, która szybko redukuje się do minimalnej obrączki. w aromacie stajnia, obornik, sporo słodko-owocowych nut funky, ale wszystko na subtelnym poziomie, bez nut wiodących. w smaku delikatna kwaśność, podbita przez stonowaną goryczkę, bardzo przyjemne i pijalne.

Draft Third of a Pint at GBBF 2016 (Day 2), Olympia, London Aug 2016 - Hazy Orangey Gold in colour. Good creamy off-white head. Good lacing. Very Fruity; oranges, tangerines, some tropical fruits. Yeasty. Spicy; peppery. Hoppy; piney hops. Malty; biscuity malts. Crisp. Bittersweet very fruity yeasty spicy throughout. Dry finish. Very tasty. Lovely fruity Belgian Ale! (2016-08-10)
Birra belga brettata, fruttata, dolce-acida, rotonda, corposa, vino bianco, spezie
750 from Whole Foods PM. Pours hazy straw with splotchy, off-white head. Nose is yeasty funk, citrus, florals. Tastes floral, yeasty, funky, with some tropical citrus.
Als Neuheit auf der Biermesse in BXL gekostet. Goldamber mit weißem Schaum. In der Nase relativ neutral. Ausgewogene Fassaromen.

On tap @Open Baladin (Rome). Pours cloudy amber with a medium white head. Aroma of bretta, sole, leather, cheese, tangerine zest. Flavour is light sweet, malty, very well balanced, light fruity sourness. Medium body, medium carbonation. Wow!

Tap at Hair of the Dog.

A; Cloudy gold-orange, foamy white head. 

N: Pear, green apple, soap, peppercorn, esters, biscuit, pine, lemon, and coriander.

T: Sweet and spicy.

M: Medium body, creamy carbonation, no alcohol.

O: A very nice Belgian ale. I would like to try this next to Orval, as I think it has a number of the same qualities.

Toccamalto/Praire Okie Matilde. Ótima Belgian Pale Ale com Brett. Releitura da querida Orval.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: OCT 10, 2016 Bottle from toccalmatto bottle shop fidenza Italy. Pours a golden colour beer with a medium head. Fruity, bretty with hops, yeast and some wood. Dry finish

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 9th August 2016GBBF Day 1. Cask. Hazy gold beer, small white head. Light palate, semi dry and with decent fine carbonation. Modest bretty sourness. Light citric peel, marmalade. A little tropical fruits, peach and mango identifable, Back to the brett on the light finish. Nice.

Birra dal colore dorato intenso con una spessa schiuma bianca.
Aroma di arancia, albicocca, mela e pepe. Sapore di arancia, albicocca disidratata, mela, scorza di limone, un po di acidità e leggermente piccante. Media carbonatazione dal corpo medio. Piacevolmente secca ,amaro da luppolo a base di erbe nel finale. Si sentono un sacco gli agrumi e delle spezie. Davvero molto piacevole. Bravi.

Soft fruitiness, grapefruit, sweet orange. Hazy, pale gold, massive, frothy, white head. Light sour. Soft, creamy citrus fruits continue, tangerine, grapefruit, soft carbonation, sour finish. Nice Sour, soft and subtle yet complex fruits in aroma and palate. Cask at GBBF16, Olympia.

Draught at the Konttori, Tampere, Finland. 
Hazy orange golden color with a small off-white head. 
Yeast, some fruity hops, some sweetness and some tartness in the aroma. Delicious. Belgian yeast, mild bitterness, rubber and some hops.

Keg at The GBBF, London. A slightly hazy deep golden colour with a thick, frothy white head. 
Aroma of orange, apricot, Brett, some apple, a little pepper and slight spicy, herbal hops. 
Taste of orange, apricot, some apple, maybe lemon, slight pepper, a little Brett sourness and subtle spicy, herbal hops. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dry, bretty, herbal hop bitterness in the finish. A Brett Belgian ale alright, lots of citrus, some pepper and spicy, herbal hops, not to mention the Brett throughout. Really enjoyable.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a tulip. Cloudy orange with medium hit head which dissipate quickly. Aroma is orange, medium body, well carbonated, and medium carbonation which dies down to light carbonation, and little carbonation. Taste is orange, mineral yeast, orange peel, and dry finish.

Pours clear amberblonde. Good White head. Smell is Brett, bit sweet. Taste is full on Brett, yet very fresh, but grainy. Orval, yes, but more brett-intense and less bitter. Even has a certain below-the-surface sweetness to it. Ok

Tap at Konttori, Tampere. Slightly hazy orange-golden color, good creamy white head, lace. Fruity, herbal, yeasty aroma. Light to medium-bodied. Belgi yeasty, flowery, airy easy. I am not the dan of Karmeliet and either this.

Aroma has citrus, yeast, malt, apples. Taste is fruity with long quite dry aftertaste. Flavors of sour apples, apricot, malt, yeast, bretta. Very fruity and tasty one.

bottle. Golden and hazy with a two finger head. Medium Brett is lightly funky with some fruity notes and just a bit of hop bite. This would be better if the flavor was dialed up just a bit more. It does go down very easy.
Trocken hopfig bitterer, leicht säuerlicher Antrunk. Dieser Eindruck bleibt nur kurz, dann eher herb, mild grasiger Hopfen. Brett. 10/9/9/9//9

Bottle shared at Cotts Convention ii, thanks to Shane, 05/03/16.
Hazed golden orange with a decent off white covering.
Nose is funky, apricots, tangy orange, yeast esters, straw.
Taste comprises funky notes, apple skin, apricot, bitter orange, damp hay, light spice.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent saison-esque Belgian.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle thanks to cgarvieuk dregs run. Pours cloudy gold. Nose of tropical fruit, orange peel, green apple. Taste is bitter, dry, not as tart as was expected from nose.

Bottle thanks to cgarvieuk dregs run. 
Appearance - cloudy lemon orange.
Nose -sour and salty orange. 
Taste - more of the same. 
Palate - medium bodied with a tangy texture and a long dry tangy finish 
Overall - decent example
Gusher. Pours cloudy golden orange with a huge white head which soon recedes. Aroma is brett citrus zest, black pepper. Taste is citrus zest, herbs, lemon bitter.
Bottle at Craigs. Gusher! Pours hazy yellow gold with a thick white head. Aromas of faint wild yeast, funk, Brett. Taste is dry, sherbet. Faint lemon. Thin finish.
Bottle at craigs, gusher. Pours hazy orange, nose is barnyard funk, toffee, bretty, taste is dry, bitter, fruity.
bottle at home ... hazy amber .. thin white head ... soft funk fruit nose ... horseblanket .. fizzy ... horse funk .. dry fruit .. log dry sour funk ... bah
750ml bottle at Seattle tasting. Bright, hazy gold. Creamy white foam. Bright fruit, pale malt, brighter yeast, light brett. Apricot, lemon, spritely body, cloudy and warm.

Bottle share at Cotteridge II as Toccalmatto / Prairie Okie Matilde, 6.2%. Many thanks to Shane. Vibrant orange, hazy, still, small foamy white head. Aroma is sour, a little pissy, air freshener, apricot. Body is light, tingly carbonation, a bit foamy. Taste is astringent, air freshener, mint, floral, dry finish. Vibrant and fresh tasting. Very good. (3.8)
Bottle. Cotteridge Beano v2. Hazy gold. Minimal head. Nose has grain. Lemon juice. Soft funk. Bready yeasts. Taste is crisp and light tart. Dries out.

750 ml bottle into tulip glass, no bottle dating. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy golden orange color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy off white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of lemon, lime, orange, pineapple, peach, pear, apple, white grape, light pepper, hay, straw, floral, grass, cracker, biscuit, light toast, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of bright citrus/floral hops, fruity/spicy yeast, and moderate bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big lemon, lime, orange, pineapple, peach, pear, apple, white grape, light pepper, hay, straw, floral, grass, cracker, biscuit, light toast, and yeast earthiness. Moderate yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, lime, orange, pineapple, peach, pear, apple, white grape, pepper, cracker, biscuit, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of bright citrus/floral hops, fruity/spicy yeast, and moderate bready malt flavors; with a great malt/spiciness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from yeast spiciness as well. Medium carbonation and light-moedium body; with a very smooth and lightly creamy/bready/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with zero warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent Belgian pale ale! All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of bright citrus/floral hops, fruity/spicy yeast, and moderate bready malt flavors; and very smooth and easy to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

Bottle big thanks to Shane at the 2016 Cotteridge Convention. It pours cloudy golden  amber with a thick white head. The aroma is fresh, bready malts, funky, Granny Smith apple, tropical citrus, sherbet, white wine and vanilla. The taste is crisp, bitter, clean, soda water, funky action, earth, hay, vanilla and grape must with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Good fun.
Bottle at CWC II; hazy golden amber pour with a thin white head, aroma has funk and some citrus action, taste has some decent citrus hop action back up with brett, floral, yeast.

Cotteridge Convention II. Bottle shared thanks to s_hartshorne, cheers Shane. Hazy Amber beer with medium head. Aroma of passionfruit and citrus. Taste is boiled sweets and some fruity hoppiness. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at the Cotteridge Convention - 2016 edition. Cheers for sharing this one! Pours cloudy gold with a big, foamy white head. The nose gives away light funk, brett, melon, citrus. Light to medium sweet flavour, dry and funky, a little musty, with some grassy bitterness and old lemon rind. Medium bodied with lively carbonation. Drying on the finish, with notes of melon, musty hay, grass, tangerine. Really good stuff. One of my favourites from the day.
tried at cotteridge 2. Hazy amber colour with a beige head. aroma peach, fruity, light bitter finish.

Bottle Share at Ratebeer meet up, Cotteridge Wines, Cotteridge, Birmingham Saturday 5th March 2016   First thoughts are mmhhh... a little bit thin, Brett but fruity almost saison like, nice but a little watery. Getting quick now. A6 A4 T7 P3 Ov13 3.3
Cotteridge 2 tasting. Hazy amber lasting beige head. funky good ester peach aroma. Pretty decent in mouth too fizzy but the fruit is bang on intense peach and apricot. Pretty good. Quite liked it.

Bottle poured and split at Bobs. Very cool collaboration here, and a bit of an unexpected one for some reason. Apple like aroma. Soft orange fruit throughout, with a late spice presence. Slight hints of a sour side. Very nice unique beer.

Bottle 0.75l taste sample at the Toccalmatto brewery Fidenza Italy. Thank you Grande Bruno for fantastic day and experience.05.12.2015.Great beer tour guys ippopotamo36, Boban.Pour it hazy golden color with small white head.Aroma brett totally Orval bravo.Taste fruits,malty, nice balanced, young still.After few years it will be great to try.After taste bittery orange zest.

750mL shared by Dustin. Voluminous head but fades into surface covering lacing. Pretty traditional Belgian ale with pear sweet yeast and dough mix. Not overly malt or sugar sweet and not too estery. But still estery and sweet.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Tap at Moeder Lambic, 28th January 16. Big fluffy head, aroma is Brett, wood, hops. Taste is well balanced, some hops, little sweet. Very drinkable

750ml bottle (Koht Autumn Auction, Tallinn) (8:4:7+:4:15-3.8+)
Super fruity aroma, with a gorgeousbrett funk. Lovely softmalty grains there too. The head *tastes* amazing - lovely bitter fruity hop oils. Body is full, but has pleasant carbonation, which also helped pump up the delightful head - perhaps it was a little high, but because of the head I forgive it. Great perfumeyness, soft and floral. Later down the bottle it gets yeaster, but its a nice belgian yeast, breader, even some toasty crusts. A great beer, 750ml went down very easily. Another Toccalmatto winner, theyre building quite a reputation!

750ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Slightly hazy amber color. Huge size, thick white head, stays. Fruity, yeast, sweetish, herbal, sourish in aroma. Sweet malts, fruity, mango, fruity, mild hops in taste. Vanilla, yeast and mild herbal hops in aftertaste. Fizzy carbonation. Nice balance. Pleasant in mouth. Nice brew.

Una gran reproducción de un cláscio como es la Orval. Tendría que hacer la prueba degustando las dos al mismo tiempo pero mi registro sensorial me dice que Toccalmatto y Prairie han clavado la receta.

Bottle, shared around the table @ Stone. Very hazy bright orange body, lively lasting off white head. Aroma of funk and overripe fruit. On the palate there is a great balance between rustic yeast, sweet stonefruit, and funk. Lively mouthfeel, dry finish. Delicious.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 250 ml. draft @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Hazy golden, creamy white head. Nose is sugary orange peel with very big strange Prairie brett, honey, caramel sugar, Taste is orange peel, honey, sugar, massive same strange Prairie brett, weird, perfume, sugar, candied orange peel, sweet malt. Orange peel & sugar body. This basically tastes like a sweeter / candy sugar sweet Orval with Prairie brett. Not too big on the brett profile & it is a bit too sweet, interesting, enjoyable take on Orval even if not entirely to my preference.

750 ml bottle. Pours hazy light amber with lasting ivory head. Nice bretty barnyard dung, citrusy, dry hay, spicy, bandaid aromas. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Earthy barnyard, dusty flavors with citrus, light pit fruits, dry hay, spicy yeast---nicely drying dusty finish____very tasty brett brew.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Hazy amber colored beer with an off white head and good lacing. The smell bright with citrus, grapefruit, some grass and floral and light malt. Taste is much the same with fresh citrus mixing with the grass and floral, a clean, light malt presence and some wet hay . Medium/light body with a crisp mouthfeel and high carbonation. Very nice and drinkable. Great on a warm day

Bottle at the brewery courtesy of Bruno. Grazie. Pours bright golden dark, semi clear with a tick off white head. Nose: milled cereals, silky spicy orientation, smooth Orval feel. A joy. Mouth: dry, some lemon, clean malty body, still milled cereals. Elegant!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Good. Really soft texture. Not terribly complex. Easy enough drinking. Dont know if if Id get another.

Bottle shared. Hazy deep gold pour with lacy white head. Aroma is spicy, lots of orange, orange zest, coriander, pepper, light grassy hoppy notes, light fruity booze. Taste is peppery, grainy, belgian malty notes. Palate is med bodied with good carbonation. Good.

Sampled June 2014
A steady pour into my teku glass produces a three finger thick, pale tan colored head. The beer is a bright amber color that shows a golden-amber hue when held up to the light. As I pour this I can smell fruity, tropical hop notes mixed with phenolic, funky Brettanomyces notes. Peaches, kumquat zest and guava all play a prominent role up front, while funky fermentation notes contribute light touches of muskiness, mustiness, and curing plastic aromatics. 

The beer is quite light bodied and effervescent, and is eminently quaffable. The dominant character is the hops and it is quite distinct with ample notes of papaya, guava, concentrated peach nectar, tropical kumquat, and just a big, floral, tropical flower nectar like character that is almost more aromatic in the flavor than actual flavor. The beer is quite dry, yet still manages to have that hugely expressive fruit hop character. It does have a lightly biting bitterness, but this is actually fairly soft compared to how expressive the hop notes are. The Brett character contributes flavors of musty, barely musky, and slightly phenolic plastic character.

This is a really nice beer, it drinks too fast for a beer of this strength. I really like the New World hop character that is so expressive in this beer. This is likely a funky leaning, amply hopped, Saisonesque beer, that is really hitting the spot for me right now.

750 ml bottle bought at Ottakringer Braukulturwochen, Vienna.
Amber, hazy body, with a big, frothy, off-white head.
Aroma of Brett, lemongrass, citrus, sweet berries, apples, some apricot, vanilla, young cheese.
Tastes of Brett, citrus, lemongrass, apples, pears, some spices, some pine, candy, slight cheese.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes dry, yeasty, sour fruity, hoppy, piney.

Very nice. Enoyable Brett aromas, pretty hoppy and very smooth. Taste could be a bit more complex though, but on the other hand really refreshing and crisp. Overall a lovely Brett ale.

Picked up at Calandros in Baton Rouge. Orange pour with a large white head. The aroma has a nice orange citrus character plus some brett and Belgian yeast. The flavor is similar. I get some subtle barnyard funk as well as some brett and yeast. There is also some juicy orange character. Medium mouthfeel and high carbonation.

750, capped. Pours a cloudy medium amber with a dense and creamy off white head. Big sweet nose, some bubble gum with mineral counterpoint. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Beautiful bubble gum and mineral mid palate with a long dry finish.

Sample from 75 cl. bottle. Hazy, amber-golden colour with a bubbly, white head. fruity aroma with yeasts, citrus fruits, bretts and caramel malts. Taste is lightly sweet. Excellent flavour. Medium body, creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and herbal-fruity with yeasts. Lovely.
hazy gold pour with good lasting head. Aroma minerals citrus yeast lemons. Big bretta. so much bretta that it has a yogurty mouthfeel. Tastes big horse blanket some tannins

Bottle. It poured a hazy amber color with an off-white head. The aroma was of brett, some sour fruit and herbs. The taste was similar to the aroma with more sourness and a medium to heavy sweet and sour finish. It had a medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Very nice.
Bottled. An unclear golden beer with a lazing yellowish head. The aroma has notes of lemons, straw, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, fruits, straw, leading to a bitter finish
Bottled. Orange coloured. Unclear. Dense light beige head. Aroma. Sweetness, yeast, fruits, spcie, citrus. Flavour. Frutis, citrus, yeast, sweetness, grape. Medium bodied. Ends sweet and citric.

Bottle at yespr.
Hazy amber colored with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, pine needles and brett.
Fruity flavor of hops and pine needles with notes of brett.
Hoppy finish.

cloudy yellow, flufy offwhite head.
aroma is mild yeasty, mild wheaty, faint bitter yellow fruity.
flavor is yellow fruity, malts.

Aroma and taste is fruity and floral hoppy, some lemon citric notes, straw, hay, herbal and bretty notes in the house.
75 cl bottle. Hazy orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, fruit, spice, malt and brettanomyces.
75 cL bottle. Pours hazy with a small white head. Aroma is bretty and light herbal. Smooth fruity. Lingering fruity and solid bretty. Smooth fruity and bitter, slight herbal finish.

Pours hazy orance / light amber with a large white head. The aroma grass sulfur, pale malt, brett funk, herbal hops and some light stone fruit. It has a medium crisp body with a good amount of frothy carbonation. The flavor starts with dry crackers, pale malt, grass, sulfur, earhty / woody hops and some citric notes. The finish has dry Belgian character and woody / papery notes. A really well constructed beer.
Bottle. Golden body with nice lasting white head. Aroma is bretts with fruits and hints of pepper or mint? Taste is very dry with fruits. Aftertaste is sour a little bit soapy and bitter. Nice.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy golden with low beige head. Aroma is of belgian yeast, fruits, flowers, bretts. Taste is of belgian yeast, fruits, bitterness, bretts. Palate: Medium-full bodied. Medium carbonation. Overall: Quite nice. Interesting bretts. Orvalesque. Not feeling very fresh to me.
Bottle. Pours yellow gold. Nose/taste of tangy citrus, light pine, brett, light funk, leaves, bubblegum, earthy peppercorn - lighter medium body.

Bottle (750 ml) bought @ Craft Beer Cellar Waterbury. Gusher. Split with the Québec crew.

Appearance: I had the first pour out of the bottle and it was slightly hazy bright golden with a small white head, low retention and little lacing. The later pours were dirtier. 

Aroma: Herbal and leathery brettanomyces forward along peppery notes, Belgian yeast, mild to moderate frutiness and earthy notes. 

Taste: Herbals, leathery brettanomyces, yeasty presence, peppery notes, earthy notes, mild fruitiness, light resinous notes and mild bitterness. 

Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Ample mouthfeel. Dry and herbal finish. 

Overall: Very tasty and easy drinking brett Belgian Ale. Theres definitely some strong similarities with Orval (and they even state it in the description of the beer), but this one feels a bit heavier despite having the same abv and doesnt have the same depth either. Dont get me wrong, this is a really nice and complex beer but considering the original is still quite a lot better than the "copy" and that I can get 4 x more quantity of Orval for the same price tag, the choice is easy.

Gusher. Pours a really hazy golden with a white rim on top that leaves some lacing. Nose is lightly smoky, fruity, spicy and giving the impression of a classic saison overall. Taste is dry, fruity and leathery/dusty. Body is medium, carbonation too and it is dry enough for my taste. Missing a little funk in my opinion, though. Overall a good but not great kind of situation.

(gush) pours hazy-cloudy golden orange with a nice reviving white head, nicely lacing. dusty, peppery and leathery bretts, juicy peaches, but also clementines, other citrus, spices - mint and dill, very fruity maltiness w/o any sweetness, lightly spicy maltiness, yeast. belgian carbonation, light body, dry and spicy-citrusy finish. solid bretty and juicy ale.

75cl bottle from Grand Cru, Rimini. It pours a hazy amber color with a large white head. Aroma is funky bretty lightly lemony and grassy, with notes of ripe peaches, mango, grass, lemon peel and hay. Taste is again lightly funky, bretty, lemony, grassy, zesty with more tropical fruit salad, funk, brett and lemon. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, nice funky pale ale.

Lightly cloudy orange with a good fluffy white head. Aroma is peach pit, slight funk, lemon peel, hint of olive. Medium bodied, earthy on the palate with a hint of bitterness on the finish. Taste is spice, funk, olive, hint of citrus peel.
Bottle - Light sweaty notes, tart citrus and grass. Cloudy gold with a decent white head. Sweet and funk, with light stone fruit and a funky finish. Nice.

Pours a deep golden copper color with three fingers of tight eggshell foam. Nose is a nice blend of rustic toasted malts, fruity yeast and some grassy hop presence. Palate is smooth and balanced with perfect harmony of hops, yeast and malt profile. Light barnyard character mingles with fresh toasted malts, floral fieldgrass, soft floral citrus bitterness and a hint of round sweet malt to round out the perfect carbonation level. Deliciously executed !

In bottiglia da 75cl. Colore arancio, velata, con schiuma fine e persistente. Sentori lattici, caramello, erbaceo e fruttato finale non molto intensi. Al palato corpo leggero e scorrevole con sentori lattici, lime con malto e caramello. Finale speziato-erbaceo con frutta esotica in sottofondo. Buona bevuta

Buonissima bevuta. Birra molto zesty,funky, amara sul finale con un equilibrio molto buono ed una leggerezza unica. Caramello,.spezie, erbe sul finale. Corpo medio,tessitura esile, carbonatazione medio-bassa. Buona birra.
Bottle..Pour is golden with a bubbly head...Nose is belgian yeast, musty, caramel, hay...Taste is caramel, spice, dry, candi sugar, spice..

Golden peach pour with one finger white head that dissipates and leaves a layer. Nice bretty, yeasty and funky nose. Cob webs and yeast with a citrus lilt. Wet at first then dry as a bone. Medium body with an average palate. Taste is dominated by dusty Brett's, vinyl and yeast. Some funk and citrus zest. Nice enough. Over bretty.

Appassionato di Orval, non vedevo lora di poter provare questo prodotto. Si presenta con una schiuma leggera e persistente, con un color ambrato molto più torbido rispetto all Orval. Ha sapori fruttati con alta presenza di luppolo e malto! un ottima bevuta.

20/I/15 - 75cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ Joliens place - BB: n/a (2015-61) 
Slow gusher alert!
Clear deep blond beer, aery off-white head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very floral, bit soapy, yeasty, sweet, peaches and apricots, perfume. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: sourish, soapy, very floral, pot pourri, soft bitterness. Aftertaste: floral yeasty, bit grassy, soapy, coriander.
75 cl bottle. Hazy golden with frothy head. Spicy aroma, notes of apricot, flavour has some bitterness, notes of hazelnut, dry finish

Cityfresh, Brooklyn bottle: Pours explosions! Pale gold with a white head. Aroma is brett, fruit, and spice. Taste is bretty, but not really earthy. It adds a nice little tingle. Very gentle beer that is easy drinking, but not lacking in complexity.

had this months ago. Light, no foam, reminds me hazy apple juice. Aroma has some fresh brett, old apples, pleasantly sour. Taste is soft, drinkable, apple juice and brett. Sour light ale. Very pleasant and easygoing. Aftertaste is not too agressive. Nicely drinkable and complex at the same time.
[6931-20141129] Bottle. Yeasty lemon peel aroma. Hazy, pale orange body with a medium-lasting foamy off-white head. Yeasty lemon grains flavour. Medium body. Good. (7/3/8/3/15) 3.6
Nice, under spoken beer. Pours amber with ok head and lacing. Light bretta. Light tart finish. Well-balanced. Some citrus. Thanks to Travlr for sharing this bottle at Churchkey.

Bottle at Churchkey courtesy of me, thank me very much! Hazy straw color, bright white head with good retention. Aroma if lightly spiced and fruity lemon. Taste us funky barnyard straw and haystacks. Nice.
Orange and cloudy pour from bomber at lakeview. Lemon and orange aroma. Carbonated and fizzy. Pineapples and lemon peel. Interesting. Enjoyable.
Sample during RBSG. From notes. Tart and funky with Brett and some spicy Belgian yeast.

2014-11-29. Hazy orange body with a small white head. 3+ Aroma is interesting, notes of dry apricot with an earthy touch. 7+ Flavour is relatively mild, lightly bitter, light pepper notes and a dry finish. Interesting. 7+ Average bodied palate, soft carbonation. Very interesting. Bottle shared by Will
A very dry bretty musk quality dominates this beer, champagne-like in nature. Dry, lively carbonation, a bit of zing, pretty rustic, good beer overall.

Boutielle 75cl.
Orangée, col blanc-cassé crémeux.
Arôme offre un fruité modéré avec ce bouquet très typique de brett le tout ponctué par un léger grains.
Palais de brett ci aussi, rien de spécial à y trouver. Effervescence moyenne voire haute, houblonné un peu sec rappelant le houblon noble avec un fini feuillus tirant sur des feuilles de citron. Parait sur un houblonnage à cru avec, je le déplore encore, une impression de brett maintes fois utilisée. Ce dernier tend à conférer ce profil rappelant le raisin blanc voir labricot. SI cest pour rendre hommage à Orval alors autant utiliser leur levure.
750 ml bottle from The Beer Trappe. Orange color. Big brett nose. Has a bit of brett to a semi dry body. Slightly Orval in taste.

7.5000e+5mm³ bottle .. . very nice beer .. . mild funk and brett, very refreshing feel to it .. . hay, straw, and dry leaves also .. . light spritz .. . solid finish .. . recommended for sure, great beer! .. . . i did the pancake dance this morning, and it worked. pancakes for lunch!

Bottle from Pazzeria, Milan; bb 31/12/2018, L13093Hazy golden color with frothy head. The aroma reminds immediately the Orval, it has almost the same depth and funkiness; but it ha light esters that are usually not present in Orval, and very light hazelnuts. Dry mouthfeel; the Brett character is mild, the astringency absent, the bitterness quite low.Nice, but not biting.

Bottle @ home. Cloudy light amber pour with a huge white head and some mild gushing. More of a musty, funky, leathery beer than anything. Some baked apple, hay, and orange zest. Slightly peppery and tart. Flavor has some nice apple and citrus zest. Fairly grassy and funky. Slightly earthy and spicy. Some yeast, leather, hay, and an overall dampness. Very dry and mildly tart.

Gushing to fast gone, off-white head. Brett-nose. Orval clone, indeed. Laurel/bayleaf, citrus, aromatic soap. In the background, cocoa. BItter, hopp, dry spices in the background. Leather, felt, Bretts. I miss the weird olive taste from Orval. Very spritzy, slick, yeast-filled; Just short of greatness.

This beer here, this beer I had @ the Grand Tasting... Compliments of myself, kind soul that I am. 
Pours blonde with a good head and some lacing on the glass.

The aroma is just a touch soapy, but at the same time floral, earthy and funky with a little bit of hay. 

The flavor is dry but has some light tropical fruit. Its plenty bitter with some nice leafy hops and a little big of lemony character. 

The palate is plenty lively.

A nice homage

Bottle. Poured a hazy amber color with an average frothy off-white head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy brett sour fruit and herbal aroma. Medium to abundant body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sour flavor with a medium to heavy sweet & sour finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout beer for style.

Taste from a 750ml bottle at a bottle share in Athens, OH. Hazy amber orange color. Thin off-white head. Leaves good, thicker lace. Medium to bigger body. Smooth, kind of soft, lighter carbonation. Slick texture. Moderate tart taste, bigger sweet taste. Caramel malt, mild peppery, toasty. Some orange zest. White peppercorn. Pretty tasty saison. Tart, complex, funky.

Bottle... Hazy golden ale with a mid-sized, fluffy, white head. Fantastic, tight retention. The nose is fruity, funky and resiny with a light clove phenol. Light to medium-bodied with champagne-like carbonation. The flavor is fuzzy stone fruits, light resiny bitterness and mild funky, vinous acidity with only a hint of pale malt sweetness. Crisp, lightly phenolic finale. Bottle courtesy of biggsbowler!

Butelka 75cl. 
OCZY : piwo jest mętne o kolorze pomarańczowym z zółtymi prześwitami. Piana piwa jest spora i biała. 

NOS : aromat piwa wskazuje na nuty podobne do lambika : tarta, zielone jabłko, rabarbar, skórka cytryny, drewno, gotowana wiśnia, rabarbar i ocet winny. Ogólnie bardzo świeże w zapachu. Można wyczuć również czerstwy chleb, słodkie nuty przypominające coś między cukrem, karmelem i miodem. Do tego grejpfrut i obora. 

USTA : mocno gazowane o puszystej konsystencji podobnej do mleka. 
Piwo jest wielowymiarowe. Nie jest tak kwaśne jak zapowiadało się po aromacie. Tak na prawdę to jest świetnie wyważone i dzika kwaśność nie zdominowała tego piwa ale nadała mu kolejny wymiar. Piwo jest wytrawne i trzeba przyznać, przypomina Orvala. Nuty słodowe przypominają czerstwy chleb i słodką tarte z niuansami pestek dyni i słonecznika. Do tego cierpkie orzechy włoskie, surowy rabarbar. Przebija się również słodycz w postaci oranżady. Jest to wyczuwalne aż do końca. Gorzkość jest średnia i bardzo cytrusowa podobna do skórki pompelo i pestek mandarynki. Trzeba dodać również wyczuwalne nowe nuty cierpkie podobne do drewna. Posmak tego piwa jest przyjemny i przypomina kompot z rabarbaru, oranżadę, drewno, skórkę cytrusowa i goździki. 

ODCZUCIA : nieźle. Skurczybyki zrobili piwo prawie że idealnie pod mój gust. Przy okazji bardzo złożone i ORZEŹWIAJĄCE! Trudno o tak dobry miks. Polecam. 

OCENA : 
smak : 8/10
pijalność : 8/10
styl : +2

My Bottom Line:
Citrus fruit, flowers and straw whirl about this Wild Ales elegant mouthfeel, creating quite an impression on the finishing bitter resins.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the cloudy beige.
-Carbonation is appropriately spritzy.
-This is as complex as it is drinkable.
-This is an obvious cousin of Orval.

Bottle.

Bottle. Amber beer with a dark cream head. Brett and tart aroma with light citrus. Brett and tart flavor with light malt and light citrus. Medium bodied. Brett and tartness lingers with citrus and light spice.

750 ml bottle purchased from Blackwells. Pours a hazy dark golden color with lasting white head. Aroma is lemon zest, barnyard funk, hops and oak complexity. Flavor is same, with Belgian yeast complexity. Delicious.

The beer is hazy and dark golden with a small, white head. Excellent duration. Aromas of light spice, citrus, hay, grass, floral hops. Delicious and easy drinking. What fucking time is it? Aww shit its late. Anyway, this is fantastic just like all of the other Prairie beers I have had thus far. Tasty bros...

Wow an excellent modern Orval homage. Bouncy, playful and the hop/brett interplay is delightful. Some bubblegum and toffee. Dry, spritzy finish. Top stuff from a great Italian brewer (and the Americans)

Bottle thanks to Eric. Pours a cloudy yellow orange with large frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is strong funk, yeast, and oak. Medium mouthfeel with nice yeast and strong funk with lingering dry finish. Very good.

Bottle @ RBSG Grand Tasting. Pours a hazy golden color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty bretty aroma. Fruity malty bretty spicy yeasty flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy bretty finish with weak hoppy hints.
Bottle during RBSG 2014 Grand Tasting at Schlafly Tap Room. Yellow with off-white head. Aromas of Brett and funk. Tastes of funk, citrus, Brett, light herbs and spices. Medium body with a dry finish.
Hazy tan with a huge head. Great wet farm fruity funk hop aromas. The sip has a wet bitter hop front that tartly cleans right up leaving a grapefruit skin finish.
Bottle. Aroma is great, lots of Brett, funky, really nice. Taste is good, nice and dry. Tart. Very refreshing. A winner!

Hazy golden in color... Aroma of barnyard funk, floral potpourri, lavender soap, brett... Mouthfeel is effervescent, flavor is earthy and grainy, hints of citrus, lavender, dry brett funk finish... Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours hazy yellow. Aroma is bretta, acid, apple, funky and wood. Flavour is wood, sour, fruity and dirt. Funky too!
No head, hazy golden color. Sour funky nose with oak, and tons of Brett. Light body, but lacks carbonation. Decent and light body, fairly interesting, but needs more carbonation.
Bottle from Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours blonde with a rich off-white head and a strange fruity aroma. There is a carbonated caramel malt flavor with a bit of brett sourness. A pleasant drink.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours hazy orange tinged gold with an off-white head. Aroma is celery with a touch of brett. Flavor is earthy/bretty with some light fruit. Sour it is. Finishes earthy/sour/ bretty. Excellent.

750 ml bottle to goblet (shared with the NC crew). Looks good; a translucent orange with white head. Smells bretty and yeasty. Tastes like it smells with a solid mouthfeel thats fairly dry. Enjoyable.

Bottle at home to wine glass. Pour is slightly hazy orange with a big cream head and great lacing. Bretty, herbal, bandaid, tropical fruity, grassy, straw, biscuity, and lemony aroma. Taste is vibrant brett and Belgiany notes - medicinal, grass, mango, papaya, white pepper, basil, and coriander with a spicy, lightly tart finish. Medium body with crisp carbonation. Awesome Belgian saison/Orval tribute. Nice!
Bottle from Irreale, Madrid. Pours wild and hazy old gold witha stable head. Funky farmyard nose. Sweet fruitiness neatly balanced by cellar dryness. Good one.

750 ml bottle poured a clear golden amber with a small lasting white head. Aromas of straw, horse blanket, fruitiness and light floral notes. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of straw, horse blanket, fruitiness and a hint of floral notes with a crisp dry lingering funky straw finish.
Poivré et bretté sans la lourdeur de la levure et les céréales sy baignent allègrement. Buvabilité juvénile.
Color anaranjado tupido con espuma blanca y densa. Aromas de brett. En boca es ligera y burbujeante con sabor amargo seco y terroso, Buena.
Amber hazy peach bretta ligh acidity citrus dry light body medium bitterness good drinkability

750 ml bottle from beer-shop.it served in a tulip glass. Rich sunrise orange, slightly hazy, with a huge, fluffy and persistent off-white head. Good lacing. Smelled the Brett as soon as the cap was off, but quite volatile being much more mild in the glass. Still a quite noticeable aroma of barnyard, cellar/dust notes, wet hay, unripe green fruits, spicy yeast and a good amount of hoppyness. Same notes emerging in the mouth, with just a little hint of sourness on the lips, perfectly balanced by a grassy and malty bitterness. Quite fruity and "chunky", with an aftertaste reminding a tasty strawberry jam. Average carbonation, light to medium body and creamy texture. A generous rating perhaps, but I simply adore Orval, and this one is a damn fine tribute! Well done to Bruno and Chase.
